meanings.sent1: The principal expelled the troublemaker from school.
meanings.sent2: The bouncer expelled the unruly patron from the club.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was expelled from the bird feeder multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise expelled all thoughts of sleep from my mind.
meanings.sent5: The storm expelled leaves and debris across the yard.

meanings.definition: Eject or discharge (something) from a confined space.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter expelled water from the hose to douse the flames.
meanings.sent2: The machine expelled steam from its vents.
meanings.sent3: The toaster unexpectedly expelled the burnt toast onto the counter.
meanings.sent4: The volcano expelled ash and smoke into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The pressure in the bottle expelled the cork with a loud pop.
